definition.name: Separator
definition.description: A visual divider component that creates a thin line to separate content. Built on top of Radix UI's Separator primitive, this component provides a customizable way to create horizontal or vertical separators in the UI.
definition.remarks: This component is particularly useful for creating visual boundaries between different sections of content while maintaining proper accessibility semantics.

decorative.description: When true, indicates that the separator is purely decorative and does not have semantic meaning

className.description: Additional CSS classes to apply to the separator

definition.visualLayout: A thin line that spans either horizontally or vertically based on the orientation prop. The horizontal separator has a height of 1px and full width, while the vertical separator has a width of 1px and full height.
definition.implementationNotes: The component uses Radix UI's Separator primitive for accessibility and combines it with Tailwind CSS for styling. The cn utility is used for class name merging.
